# BYLAWS OF THE Tire Industry Open Technology Foundation, Inc

*A Delaware Nonprofit Corporation (501(c)(6))*
**Effective Date:** ___________

---

## ARTICLE I – NAME AND OFFICE

### Section 1. Name

The name of the corporation is **Tire Industry Open Technology Foundation, Inc.** (“TIOTF”).

### Section 2. Principal Office

The principal office of the Corporation shall be located in the State of Delaware or at such other location as designated by the Board of Directors.

---

## ARTICLE II – MEMBERSHIP ADMINISTRATION

> *Note: Membership classes and philosophy are defined in `MEMBERSHIP.md`.
> This Article defines administration and enforcement only.*

### Section 1. Dues Administration

* Membership dues are established by the Board or Interim Governing Committee.
* Dues tiers may include Foundational, Enterprise, Standard, and Individual levels.
* Non-payment of dues for more than **90 days** may result in suspension or termination.

### Section 2. Suspension and Termination

Membership may be suspended or terminated for:

* Non-payment of dues
* Violation of antitrust, ethics, or code-of-conduct policies
* Conduct materially harmful to TIOTF or its mission

Termination requires:

1. Recommendation from the **Ethics & Governance Committee**
2. Confirmation by a **majority vote** of the Board or Interim Governing Committee

---

## ARTICLE III – INTERIM GOVERNANCE (PRE-BOARD ACTIVATION)

### Section 1. Interim Governing Committee

Until TIOTF reaches **ten (10) paying members**, governance shall be exercised by an **Interim Governing Committee** consisting of at least three (3) incorporators or appointed executives.

### Section 2. Powers

The Interim Governing Committee may:

* Admit members
* Approve operating budgets
* Establish committees and working groups
* Initiate open-source and standards programs
* Form and govern the wholly-owned subsidiary (Durion Solutions, Inc.)

The Interim Governing Committee **may not**:

* Amend the Charter
* Dissolve or liquidate TIOTF
* Dispose of intellectual property

### Section 3. Board Activation

Upon reaching ten (10) paying members:

* The Interim Governing Committee dissolves
* Board elections begin within **60 days**
* The Board is seated once representation requirements are met

---

## ARTICLE IV – BOARD OPERATIONS

> *Board composition and authority are defined in `BOARD_AND_OFFICERS.md`.
> This Article defines procedures only.*

### Section 1. Terms

* Directors serve **two (2) year** terms
* Terms may be staggered
* Directors may be reelected without limit

### Section 2. Meetings

* The Board shall meet at least **quarterly**
* Special meetings may be called by the Chair or any three (3) Directors
* Remote participation is permitted

### Section 3. Quorum and Voting

* Quorum: **50%** of seated Directors
* Standard actions: **majority vote**
* Charter, IP, or licensing changes: **two-thirds vote**

---

## ARTICLE V – OFFICERS (PROCEDURAL)

> *Officer roles are defined in `BOARD_AND_OFFICERS.md`.*

### Section 1. Appointment

Officers are appointed annually by the Board.

### Section 2. Removal

Officers may be removed by majority vote of the Board, with or without cause.

---

## ARTICLE VI – COMMITTEE AUTHORITY

> *Committee structure is defined in `COMMITTEES_AND_COUNCILS.md`.*

### Section 1. Delegated Authority

Committees may:

* Draft technical specifications
* Propose standards, releases, and certifications
* Create subcommittees or working groups
* Recommend cybersecurity policies

Committees may **not**:

* Bind TIOTF financially
* Amend the Charter or Bylaws
* Represent TIOTF externally without authorization

---

## ARTICLE VII – FINANCIAL CONTROLS

### Section 1. Fiscal Year

The fiscal year shall be determined by the Board.

### Section 2. Audits and Reviews

* Annual audits or financial reviews shall be conducted by an independent firm
* Results shall be reported to the Board

### Section 3. Use of Funds

All funds shall be used exclusively to further TIOTF’s **501(c)(6)** mission.

---

## ARTICLE VIII – SUBSIDIARY OVERSIGHT (REFERENCE)

> *Detailed governance is defined in `/SUBSIDIARY/*` documents.*

* TIOTF shall wholly own Durion Solutions, Inc.
* The Board appoints subsidiary directors
* All profits flow back to TIOTF or are reinvested in the mission
* Subsidiary actions must remain aligned with Foundation policies

---

## ARTICLE IX – DISSOLUTION

Upon dissolution:

* Assets shall be transferred to another **501(c)(6)** or **501(c)(3)** organization with a similar mission
* No assets may benefit private individuals or for-profit entities

---

## ARTICLE X – AMENDMENTS

These Bylaws may be amended by a **two-thirds vote** of the Board of Directors.
